intro: Cleomella stenosperma, commonly known as the narrow-fruit cleome, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruit is a slender, cylindrical capsule that splits open to release seeds. Cleomella stenosperma is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
